result.execSummary:
The defendant Carmen J Purvis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Any other sentence, FIRST 6 MONTHS STRAIGHT TIME, remainder can be served with Huber or Day Reporting Center
COURT APPROVES TRANSFER OF PROBATION TO ANOTHER STATE IF DEEMED APPROPRIATE BY THE DEPARTMENT

miscConds.notes: Pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment: All court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA; All applicable fees of supervision.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety from illegal drugs.
- No possess/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain full time employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 1 YEAR at the House of Corrections with 5 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence.   First 6 MONTHS STRAIGHT TIME, remainder can be served with Huber or Day Reporting Center.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 18 MONTHS probation.  Court approves transfer of probation to another state if deemed appropriate by the department.

  Conditions of Probation:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety from illegal drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied if applicable. 

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Carmen J Purvis in court with attorney David C. Bangert.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for jury trial, however parties would like to proceed with a plea hearing instead.   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant Carmen J Purvis in court with attorney David C. Bangert.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 22 on 01/27/2016, however the time is changed from 9:00am to 10:00am.  State keeps their offer open until 01/20/2016.

Defendant Carmen J Purvis in court with attorney David C. Bangert.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
